memberdef.argsstring: (FT squared_radius, bool separate_shells=false, bool force_manifold=false, FT border_angle=45.)
memberdef.name: Alpha_shape_mesher

briefdescription.para: Constructs an alpha shape mesher.

detaileddescription.para:
squared_radius
$\alpha$ parameter of the alpha shape algorithm.
separate_shells
determines whether to collect the surface per shell.
force_manifold
determines if the surface is forced to be 2-manifold.
border_angle
sets the maximal angle between two facets such that the edge is seen as a border.
If the output is forced to be 2-manifold, some almost flat volume bubbles are detected. To do so, border edges must be estimated.

An edge adjacent to 2 regular facets is considered as a border if it is also adjacent to a singular facet or if the angle between the two regular facets is lower than this parameter (set to 45Â° by default).

simplesect.para: border_angle is not used if force_manifold is set to false.

briefdescription.para: gives the number of triangles of the surface.
gives an iterator to the first triple in the surface.
gives an iterator to the first triple in the surface.

simplesect.para: Changes to the surface may change its topology.

briefdescription.para: gives a past-the-end iterator of the triples in the surface.
gives a past-the-end iterator of the triples in the surface.

simplesect.para: Changes to the surface may change its topology.

briefdescription.para: gives the number of shells of the surface.
gives an iterator to the first triple in a given shell.

parameterdescription.para: is the index of the shell to access.

simplesect.para: shell is in the range [ 0, number_of_shells() ).

briefdescription.para: gives an iterator to the first triple in a given shell.

parameterdescription.para: is the index of the shell to access.

simplesect.para: shell is in the range [ 0, number_of_shells() ).
Changes to a shell may invalidate the topology of the surface.

briefdescription.para: gives a past-the-end iterator of the triples in a given shell.

parameterdescription.para: is the index of the shell to access.

simplesect.para: shell is in the range [ 0, number_of_shells() ).

parameterdescription.para: is the index of the shell to access.

simplesect.para: shell is in the range [ 0, number_of_shells() ).
Changes to a shell may invalidate the topology of the surface.

briefdescription.para: gives an iterator to the first triple of the garbage facets that may be discarded if 2-manifold output is required.
gives an iterator to the first triple of the garbage facets that may be discarded if 2-manifold output is required.
gives a past-the-end iterator of the triples of the garbage facets that may be discarded if 2-manifold output is required.
gives a past-the-end iterator of the triples of the garbage facets that may be discarded if 2-manifold output is required.
Surface mesher for scale space reconstruction based on CGAL::Alpha_shape_3.

detaileddescription.para: The surface can be constructed either for a fixed neighborhood radius, or for a dynamic radius. When constructing the surface for exactly one neighborhood radius, it is faster to set FixedSurface to Tag_true. If the correct neighborhood radius should be changed or estimated multiple times, it is faster to set FixedSurface to Tag_false.

It is undefined whether a surface with fixed radius may have its radius changed, but if so, this will likely require more computation time than changing the radius of a dynamic surface. In either case, it is possible to change the point set while maintaining the same radius.

The surface can be stored either as an unordered collection of triangles, or as a collection ordered by shells. A shell is a maximally connected component of the surface where connected facets are locally oriented towards the same side of the surface.

parameterdescription.para: is the geometric traits class. It must be a model of DelaunayTriangulationTraits_3. It must have a RealEmbeddable field number type. Generally, Exact_predicates_inexact_constructions_kernel is preferred.

determines whether the surface is expected to be constructed for a fixed neighborhood radius. It must be a Boolean_tag type. The default value is Tag_true. Note that the value of this parameter does not change the result but only has an impact on the run-time.
